statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ 3 \\ 0 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 13 \\ -9 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ 3 \\ 0 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 13 \\ -9 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
